descriptionHtml:
Ever wanted robes to join the Dawnguard as a mage, but found their armor less than satisfactory for your spell-slinging needs? Look no further! This mod adds a full set of enchanted Dawnguard robes for both male and female, beast races included.

Adds robes, boots, a hood, and a pair of gloves!

Requires Dawnguard.

A full set of enchanted robes can be found in Fort Dawnguard, in the alchemy/enchanting area. A full, unenchanted set can be crafted at a tanning rack with various combinations of linen wraps and leather strips.

ENCHANTED SET - ENCHANTMENTS:

[i]Hood: Increases your Magicka by 30 points [/i](The last thing you need is to be caught low on Magicka when fighting packs of blood-starved vampires.)
[i]Robes: +100% Magicka regen, restoration spells cost 17% less to cast[/i] (Ditto - these are similar to robes you can get at the College of Winterhold.)
[i]Boots: Sneaking is 25% better[/i] (Discretion is the better part of valor, and it's also the better part of not getting your neck chomped while you're crawling around underground without wearing armor.)
[i]Gloves: Restoration spells cost 15% less to cast[/i] (Same reasoning as the first two.)

INSTALLATION:

Extract contents of DawnguardRobesFull.zip, and copy them into your Skyrim/Data directory.

GOING FROM 1.0 (no unenchanted set) to 1.1 (adds an unenchanted set):

All you need to do is grab the "DawnguardRobesV1 to V1-1" file, and overwrite the "Dawnguard Robes.esp" in your Data folder with the new one from that file.

CURRENT ISSUES:

For some reason, I had issues applying the textureset to the female 1st person arms (basically means that light affects them weirdly - they're always dark and really shiny). I did a half fix for this, letting it default the female 1st person arms for this robe to the male 1st person arms. The difference isn't extremely obvious, and the mod functions perfectly well, but if someone knows a fix for this, I would be much obliged.
